page.title: 16Industry_Quarrying
page.content: There is a small limestone quarry near Great Ponton, which employs 2 people. The stone mainly goes to local areas,not just for building but for landscape gardening as weel.Mr. Beauchamp showed us a fossil,found in a nearby quarry which was dated back to 250 million years ago.Lorries from the quarry do not go through Great Ponton but turn left onto the B6403 (Ermine Street).The road is very dusty and does get muddy during the Winter.The surface is getting a little rough due to the heavy pounding of the lorries. There is no other industry in Great Ponton apart from a disused warehouse which now stores pallets.The parish council hopes to remove this eyesore shortly.
